sen.j: 在原業平（ありわら の なりひら、天長2年（825年） - 元慶4年5月28日 (旧暦)（880年7月9日））は平安時代初期の貴族。
sen.e: ARIWARA no Narihira (825 (birth date unknown) - July 9, 880) was an aristocrat who lived in the early Heian period.
ARIWARA no Narihira (825 - July 9, 880) was an aristocrat who lived in the early Heian period.
ARIWARA no Narihira (825 - July 13, 880) was an aristocrat who lived in the early Heian period.

sen.j: 歌人であり、六歌仙、三十六歌仙のひとり、また伊勢物語の主人公とみなされる。
sen.e: He was a poet being a member of Rokkasen (Six best Waka poets) and Sanjurokkasen (Thirty-six immortal poets), and he is also considered to be the main character of Ise Monogatari (The Tales of Ise).
He was a poet, being a member of Rokkasen (Six best Waka poets) and Sanjurokkasen (Thirty-six immortal poets), and he is also considered to be the main character of Ise Monogatari (The Tales of Ise).
He was a poet, being a member of Rokkasen (Six best Waka poets) and Sanjurokkasen (Thirty-six immortal poets), and he is also considered to be the main character of Ise Monogatari (The Tales of Ise).

sen.j: 父は平城天皇第一皇子の阿保親王、母伊都内親王は桓武天皇の皇女で、業平は父方をたどれば平城天皇の孫・桓武天皇の曾孫であり、母方をたどれば桓武天皇の孫にあたる。
sen.e: His father was Imperial Prince Abo who was the first prince of Emperor Heijo, and his mother Imperial Princess Ito was a daughter of Emperor Kanmu; therefore, Narihira was a grandson of Emperor Heijo and great grandson of Emperor Kanmu in terms of his paternal lineage and was a grandson of Emperor Kanmu in terms of his maternal lineage.

His father was Imperial Prince Abo who was the eldest son of Emperor Heijo and his mother, Imperial Princess Ito, was a daughter of Emperor Kanmu, meaning Narihira was a grandson of Emperor Heijo and a great grandson of Emperor Kanmu in terms of his paternal lineage and a grandson of Emperor Kanmu in terms of his maternal lineage.

His father was Imperial Prince Abo who was the eldest son of Emperor Heijo and his mother, Imperial Princess Ito, was a daughter of Emperor Kanmu, meaning Narihira was a grandson of Emperor Heijo and a great grandson of Emperor Kanmu in terms of his paternal lineage and a grandson of Emperor Kanmu in terms of his maternal lineage.

sen.j: 家系のみを見れば当代の天皇よりも嫡流といえたが、祖父・父が権力争いに負けたため臣籍に下った。
sen.e: It seems that he was of more direct-line descent of the Imperial family than the Emperor at that time as far as his family line is concerned, but he was in the vassal position as his grandfather and father lost the power struggle.
In terms of his lineage, it appears he should have had a better claim to the throne than the Emperor but he had been made a civilian after his father and grandfather had lost power struggles.
In terms of his lineage, it appears he should have had a better claim to the throne than the Emperor but he had been made a civilian after his father and grandfather had lost power struggles.

sen.j: 別称の在五中将は在原氏の五男で右近衛権中将であったことからくる。
sen.e: Narihira was also called Zaigo-chujo because he was the fifth son of the clan and was in the Ukonnoe-gon-no-chujo (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) post.

Narihira was also called Zaigo-chujo (literally Ariwara Five Captain) because he was the fifth son of the Ariwara Clan and held the post of Ukonnoe-gon-no-chujo (Deputy Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: Added "(literally Ariwara Five Captain)", "Ariwara"Capitalized 'c"was in the"→"held the post of"Added "Deputy"Deleted "post"
sen.e: Narihira was also called Zaigo-chujo (literally Ariwara Five Captain) because he was the fifth son of the Ariwara clan and held the post of Ukone no Gon no chujo (Deputy Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: Clanの頭文字を小文字に変更、Ukonnoe-gon-no-chujo→Ukone no Gon no chujoとしました。

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 家系からすれば天皇家の嫡流でもあったが、祖父と父が権力闘争に敗れたこともあり臣籍降下して兄在原行平らとともに在原氏を名乗る。
sen.e: Narihira was a direct-line descendent of the Imperial family in terms of family line, but he was in the vassal position and gave himself the clan name of Ariwara with his older brother ARIWARA no Yukihira since his grandfather and father lost the power struggle.

Narihira was a direct-line descendent of the Imperial family, but entered civillian life and took the clan name of Ariwara with his older brother, ARIWARA no Yukihira, after his grandfather and father had been defeated in power struggles.
sen.cmt: Deleted "in terms of family line""he was in the vassal position and gave himself the"→"entered civillian life and took""since"→"after""lost the"→"had been defeated in"Added 's'
sen.e: Narihira was a direct-line descendent of the Imperial Family, but entered civillian life and took the clan name of Ariwara with his older brother, ARIWARA no Yukihira, after his grandfather and father had been defeated in power struggles.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに基づき、天皇家→Imperial Familyとしました。

sen.j: 仁明天皇の蔵人となり、嘉祥2年（849年）従五位下に進むが、文徳天皇の代になると13年に渡って昇進がとまり不遇な時期を過ごした。
sen.e: He became a kurodo (sovereign's secretary) of Emperor Ninmyo and was promoted to the Jugoige rank (Junior fifth rank, lower grade) in 849; however, he suffered through a 13-year period without being promoted during the reign of Emperor Montoku.

He became a kurodo (chamberlain) of Emperor Ninmyo and was promoted to the Jugoige rank (Junior fifth rank, lower grade) in 849; however, he suffered a 13-year period without being promoted during the reign of Emperor Montoku.

He became a kurodo (chamberlain) of Emperor Ninmyo and was promoted to the Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 849; however, he suffered a 13-year period without being promoted during the reign of Emperor Montoku.
sen.cmt: 従五位下→統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 清和天皇のもとで再び昇進し、従五位上に序せられ、右馬頭、右近衛権中将、蔵人頭に進んだ。
sen.e: In the reign of Emperor Seiwa, he was again promoted to the Jugoijo rank (Junior fifth rank, Upper Grade), Umanokami (Minister of the horse office of the right), Ukone-no-chujo, and Kurodo-no-to (head of Kurodo).

During the reign of Emperor Seiwa, he was again promoted to the Jugoijo rank (Junior fifth rank, Upper Grade), Umanokami (Head of the Right Division of the Stables), Ukone-no-chujo (Middle Capitain of the Inner Palace Guards), and Kurodo-no-to (Head Chamberlain).
sen.cmt: "In"→"During""Minister of the horse office of the right"→"Head of the Right Division of the Stables"Added "(Middle Capitain of the Inner Palace Guards)""head of Kurodo"→"Head Chamberlain"
sen.e: During the reign of Emperor Seiwa, he was again promoted to the Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), Umanokami (Head of the Right Division of the Stables), Ukone no Gon no chujo, and Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain).
sen.cmt: 従五位上→統一リストの表記に修正、全角スペースを半角に変更、Ukone-no-chujo→Ukone no Gon no chujoに修正、補足削除、,ハイフンをとりKurodo no to としました。

sen.j: 文徳天皇の皇子惟喬親王に仕え、和歌を奉りなどした。
sen.e: He served Imperial Prince Koretaka who was the son of Emperor Montoku and gave him waka songs.
He served Imperial Prince Koretaka, the son of Emperor Montoku, writing waka poems for him.
sen.cmt: Deleted "who was"Added commas"gave him waka songs"→"writing waka poems for him"
sen.e: He served Imperial Prince Koretaka, the son of Emperor Montoku, writing waka poems for him.

sen.j: 鷹狩に執着した桓武天皇の子孫だけあり、兄在原行平ともども鷹狩の名手であったと伝えられる。
sen.e: Being descendants of Emperor Kanmu who used to be immersed in hunting with hawks, both Narihira and his older brother ARIWARA no Yukihira are said to have been skillful hunters using hawks.
Being descendants of Emperor Kanmu, who was an avid falconer, both Narihira and his older brother, ARIWARA no Yukihira, are said to have been skilled falconers.
sen.cmt: Added comma"used to be immersed in hunting with hawks"→"was an avid falconer"Added commas"skillful hunters using hawks"→"skilled falconers"
sen.e: Being descendants of Emperor Kanmu, who was an avid falconer, both Narihira and his older brother, ARIWARA no Yukihira, are said to have been skilled falconers.

sen.j: 紀有常女（惟喬親王の従姉にあたる）を妻とし、紀氏と交流があった。
sen.e: Narihira married KI no Aritsune (a cousin of Imperial Prince Koretaka) and therefore had a relationship with the Ki clan.
Narihira married KI no Aritsune (a cousin of Imperial Prince Koretaka) and was therefore related to the Ki clan.
sen.cmt: "therefore had a relationship with"→"was therefore related to"
sen.e: Narihira married the daughter of KI no Aritsune (a cousin of Imperial Prince Koretaka) and was therefore related to the Ki clan.
sen.cmt: married KI no Aritsune→married the daughter of KI no Aritsuneに訂正

sen.j: 子に在原棟梁、在原滋春、孫に棟梁の子・在原元方がありみな歌人として知られる。
sen.e: His children were ARIWARA no Muneyana and ARIWARA no Shigeharu, and Muneyana's child ARIWARA no Motokata was his grandchild, and all of them are known as poets.
His children, ARIWARA no Muneyana and ARIWARA no Shigeharu, and his grandchild, Muneyana's son, ARIWARA no Motokata, are well-known as poets.
His children, ARIWARA no Muneyana and ARIWARA no Shigeharu, and his grandchild, Muneyana's son, ARIWARA no Motokata, are well-known as poets.

sen.j: 業平は『日本三代実録』に「体貌閑麗、放縦不拘」と記され、美男の代名詞のようにいわれる。
sen.e: "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku (The True History of Three Reigns of Japan)" described Narihira as 'beautiful and graceful, and casual and easy,' introducing him as a synonym with a good-looking man.
"Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku (The True History of Three Reigns of Japan)" described Narihira as 'beautiful and graceful, and casual and easy,' the epitome of handsomeness.
sen.cmt: "introducing him as a synonym with a good-looking man"→"the epitome of handsomeness"
sen.e: "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" (The True History of Three Reigns of Japan) described Narihira as 'beautiful and graceful, and casual and easy,' the epitome of handsomeness.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションの位置を移動

sen.j: 早くから『伊勢物語』の主人公の、いわゆる「昔男」と同一視されている。
sen.e: From early on, Narihira was identified with the main character of "Ise Monogatari (The Tales of Ise)", the so-called 'Mukashi-Otoko (a man who existed a long time ago, as used in the opening sentence of each episode).'
From early on, Narihira was identified with the main character of "Ise Monogatari (The Tales of Ise)", the so-called 'Mukashi-Otoko (the man from long ago).'
sen.cmt: "a man who existed a long time ago, as used in the opening sentence of each episode"→"the man from long ago"
sen.e: From early on, Narihira was identified with the main character of "Ise Monogatari," the so-called 'Mukashi-Otoko' (the man from long ago).
sen.cmt: Ise Monogatari→既出のため (The Tales of Ise)を削除、クォーテーションの位置を移動

sen.j: ちなみに伊勢物語では、二条后こと藤原高子や惟喬親王の妹である斎宮恬子内親王などとの禁忌の恋が語られている。
sen.e: Ise Monogatari includes episodes of forbidden love with FUJIWARA no Takaiko, also as known as Nijo-no-kisaki, and Imperial Princess Yasuiko who was a Saigu (princess who was sent to the Ise-jingu Shrine on behalf of the Emperor) and also a younger sister of Imperial Prince Koretaka.

Ise Monogatari includes episodes of forbidden love with FUJIWARA no Takaiko, also as known as Nijo-no-kisaki, and also the younger sister of Imperial Prince Koretaka, Imperial Princess Yasuiko, who was a Saigu (a female relative of the Emperor sent to serve at Ise-Jingu Shrine).
sen.cmt: Moved "also a younger sister of Imperial Prince Koretaka""a"→"the""princess who was sent to the Ise-jingu Shrine on behalf of the Emperor"→"a female relative of the Emperor sent to serve at Ise-Jingu Shrine"Deleted "and"
sen.e: Ise Monogatari includes episodes of forbidden love with FUJIWARA no Takaiko, also as known as Nijo no kisaki, and also the younger sister of Imperial Prince Koretaka, Imperial Princess Yasuiko, who was a Saigu (a female relative of the Emperor sent to serve at Ise-Jingu Shrine).
sen.cmt: Nijo-no-kisakiのハイフンをとりました。

sen.j: なお、恬子内親王との間には密通によって高階茂範の養子・師尚が生まれたという説があり、以後高階氏は業平の子孫ではと噂された。
sen.e: Note that there has been a theory that Narihira and Imperial Princess Yasuiko committed adultery resulting in the birth of Moronao who was later to be adopted by Shigenori TAKASHINA, and since then, there has been a rumor that the Takashina clan were descendants of Narihira.

There is a theory that Narihira and Imperial Princess Yasuiko had an affair resulting in the birth of Moronao who was later to be adopted by Shigenori TAKASHINA, resulting in rumors that the Takashina Clan were descendants of Narihira.
sen.cmt: "Note that there has been"→"There is""committed adultery"→"had an affair""and since then, there has been"→"resulting in""a rumor"→"rumors"Capitalized 'c
sen.e: There is a theory that Narihira and Imperial Princess Yasuiko had an affair resulting in the birth of Moronao who was later to be adopted by Shigenori TAKASHINA, resulting in rumors that the Takashina clan were descendants of Narihira.
sen.cmt: Clanの頭文字を小文字に変更

sen.j: 歌人としては『古今和歌集』に30首が入集している。
sen.e: As for his career as a poet, he had 30 of his poems selected for "Kokin Wakashu (anthology of Japanese poems)."
As for his career as a poet, he had 30 of his poems selected for "Kokin Wakashu (anthology of Japanese poems)."
As for his career as a poet, he had 30 of his poems selected for "Kokin Wakashu" (A Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションの位置を移動、Kokin Wakashuの補足を変更

sen.j: 官歴
sen.e: Record of Office and Rank
Record of Office and Rank
Career
sen.cmt: 経歴と同義と解釈し、統一リストの表記を記載

sen.j: 承和 (日本)12年（845年）、左近衛将監に任官。
sen.e: In 845, he was appointed to Sa-konoe-shogen (Lieutenant in the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).
In 845, he was appointed Sa-konoe-shogen (Lieutenant in the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).
845: He was appointed Sakone no shogen (Lieutenant in the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正、Sa-konoe-shogen→Sakone no shogenとしました。

sen.j: 承和14年（847年（承和14）1月12日、蔵人に補任。
sen.e: On January 12, 847, he was appointed to Kurodo.
On January 12, 847, he was appointed Kurodo.
February 5, 847: He was appointed Kurodo.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正January 12→February 5に変更しました。

sen.j: 嘉祥2年（849年）1月7日、従五位下に叙位。
sen.e: On January 7, 849, he was appointed to the Jugoige rank.
On January 7, 849, he was appointed to the Jugoige rank.
February 7, 849: He was appointed to the Jugoinoge rank.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正、Jugoinogeとしました。January→Februaryに変更しました。

sen.j: 貞観_(日本)4年（862年）3月7日、従五位上に昇叙。
sen.e: On March 7, 862, he was promoted to the Jugoijo rank.
On March 7, 862, he was promoted to the Jugoijo rank.
April 13, 862: He was promoted to the Jugoinojo rank.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正、Jugoinojoとしました。 March 7→April 13に変更しました。

sen.j: 貞観5年（863年）2月10日、左兵衛権佐に任官。
sen.e: On February 10, 863, he was appointed to Sa-hyoegon-no-suke (Asst. Captain of the Left Division of Middle Palace Guards).
On February 10, 863, he was appointed Sa-hyoegon-no-suke (Asst. Captain of the Left Division of the Middle Palace Guards).
March 7, 863: He was appointed Sahyoe no gon no suke (Provisional Assistant Captain of the Left Division of Middle Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正、「左兵衛権佐」の表記を変更February 10→March 7に変更しました。

sen.j: 貞観6年（864年）3月8日、左近衛権少将に転任。
sen.e: On March 8, 864, he was reassigned as Sa-konoegon-shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Middle Palace Guards).
On March 8, 864, he was reassigned as Sa-konoegon-shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of the Middle Palace Guards).
April 21, 864: He was reassigned as Sakone gon no shosho (Provisional Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正、「左近衛権少将」の表記を修正March 8→April 21に変更しました。

sen.j: 貞観7年（865年）3月9日、右馬頭に遷任。
sen.e: On March 9, 865, he was transferred to the Umanokami post.
On March 9, 865, he was transferred to the post of Umanokami.
March 9, 865: He was transferred to the post of Umanokami.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正March 9→April 12に変更しました。

sen.j: 貞観11年（869年）1月7日、正五位下に昇叙し、右馬頭元の如し。
sen.e: On January 7, 869, he was promoted to the Shogoige rank (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) while still being in the Umanokami post.
On January 7, 869, he was promoted to the Shogoige rank (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) while still holding the Umanokami post.
February 25, 869: He was promoted to the Shogoinoge rank (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) while still holding the Umanokami post.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正、Shogoinogeとしました。 January 7→February 25に変更しました。

sen.j: 貞観15年（873年）1月7日、従四位下に昇叙し、右馬頭元の如し。
sen.e: On January 7, 873, he was promoted to the Jushiige rank (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) while still being in the Umanokami post.
On January 7, 873, he was promoted to the Jushiige rank (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) while still holding the Umanokami post.
February 12, 873: He was promoted to the Jushiinoge rank (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) while still holding the Umanokami post.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正、Jushiinogeとしました。 January 7→February 12に変更しました。

sen.j: 貞観17年（875年）1月13日、右近衛権中将に転任。
sen.e: On January 13, 875, he was reassigned as Ukone-no-chujo.
On January 13, 875, he was reassigned as Ukone-no-chujo.
February 26, 875: He was reassigned as Ukone no Gon no chujo.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正、Ukone-no-chujo→Ukone no Gon no chujoに修正January 13→February 26に変更しました。

sen.j: 元慶元年（877年）11月21日、従四位上に昇叙し、右近衛権中将元の如し。
sen.e: On November 21, 877, he was promoted to the Jushiijo rank (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) while still being Ukone-no-chujo.
On November 21, 877, he was promoted to the Jushiijo rank (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) while remaining Ukone-no-chujo.
January 2, 878: He was promoted to the Jushiinojo rank (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) while remaining Ukone no Gon no chujo.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正、Jushiinojoとし、Ukone-no-chujo→Ukone no Gon no chujoに修正November 21, 877→January 2, 878に変更しました。

sen.j: 元慶2年（878年）1月11日、相模権守を兼任。
sen.e: On January 11, 878, he was concurrently appointed to Sagami-no-gon-nokami (Provisional Governor of Sagami-no-kuni).
On January 11, 878, he was concurrently appointed Sagami-no-gon-nokami (Deputy Governor of Sagami Province).
February 20, 878: He was concurrently appointed Deputy Governor of Sagami Province.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正、Sagami-no-gon-nokamiを削除し、Deputy Governor of Sagami Provinceのみとしました。January 11→February 20に変更しました。

sen.j: 元慶3年（879年）10月、蔵人頭に補任。
sen.e: In October, 879, he was appointed to Kurodo-no-to.
In October, 879, he was appointed Kurodo-no-to.
October, 879: He was appointed Kurodo no to.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正、Kurodo no toとしました。

sen.j: 美濃権守兼任。
sen.e: He was concurrently appointed to Mino-no-gon-nokami (Provisional Governor of Mino-no-kuni).
He was concurrently appointed Mino-no-gon-nokami (Deputy Governor of Mino Province).
He was concurrently appointed Deputy Governor of Mino Province.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正、Mino-no-gon-nokamiを削除し、Deputy Governor of Mino Provinceのみとしました。

sen.j: 相模権守を去る。
sen.e: He resigned as Sagami-no-gon-nokami.
He resigned as Sagami-no-gon-nokami.
He resigned as Deputy Governor of Sagami Province.
sen.cmt: Sagami-no-gon-nokami→Deputy Governor of Sagami Provinceとしました。

sen.j: 元慶4年（880年）5月28日、卒去。
sen.e: He died on May 28, 880.
He died on May 28, 880.
July 13, 880: He died.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正May 28→July 13に変更しました。

sen.j: 享年56。
sen.e: He was 56 years old.
He was 56 years old.
He was 56 years old.

sen.j: 時に従四位上行右近衛権中将兼美濃権守
sen.e: When he died, he was at the Jushiijo rank, was Ukone-no-chujo, and concurrently was Mino-no-gon-nokami.
When he died, he held the Jushiijo rank, was Ukone-no-chujo, and concurrently was Mino-no-gon-nokami.
When he died, he held the Jushiinojo rank, was Ukone no Gon no chujo, and concurrently was Deputy Governor of Mino Province.
sen.cmt: Jushiijo→Jushiinojo、Ukone-no-chujo→Ukone no Gon no chujoに修正、Mino-no-gon-nokami→Deputy Governor of Mino Provinceとしました。

sen.j: ゆかりの地
sen.e: Areas associated with him
Areas associated with him
Areas associated with him

sen.j: 業平自身や業平がモデルとされる人物はさまざまな物語や文献に登場している。
sen.e: Narihira himself or characters modeled after Narihira appear in many stories or literary works.
Narihira himself or characters modeled after Narihira appear in many stories or literary works.
Narihira himself or characters modeled after Narihira appear in many stories or literary works.

sen.j: 業平に関連した伝説は日本各地に伝わっており、「業平」という地名も存在する。
sen.e: Legends featuring Narihira have spread across Japan, and there is even a place called 'Narihira.'
Legends featuring Narihira have spread across Japan, and there is even a place called 'Narihira.'
Legends featuring Narihira have spread across Japan, and there is even a place called 'Narihira.'

sen.j: 奈良県奈良市
sen.e: Nara City, Nara Prefecture
Nara City, Nara Prefecture
Nara City, Nara Prefecture

sen.j: 奈良市法蓮町にある不退寺は、仁明天皇の勅願を受け在原業平が開基した。
sen.e: The Futai-ji Temple in Horen-cho, Nara City, was founded by ARIWARA no Narihira at the request of Emperor Ninmyo.
The Futai-ji Temple in Horen-cho, Nara City, was founded by ARIWARA no Narihira at the request of Emperor Ninmyo.
The Futai-ji Temple in Horen-cho, Nara City, was founded by ARIWARA no Narihira at the request of Emperor Ninmyo.

sen.j: 寺伝によれば不退寺は、元は祖父の平城天皇が薬子の変により剃髪したのち隠棲した「萱の御所」であったとされる。
sen.e: According to the temple history, the Futai-ji Temple was originally 'Kaya no Gosho (Thatched-Roofed Imperial Palace)' where his grandfather, Emperor Heijo, had his head shaved and then retired as a result of Kusuko no Hen (the Kusuko's Rebellion).

According to the temple history, the Futai-ji Temple was originally called 'Kaya no Gosho (Thatched-Roofed Imperial Palace)' where his grandfather, Emperor Heijo, took the tonsure and then retired to as a result of the Kusuko Rebellion (Kusuko no Hen).
sen.cmt: Added "called""had his head shaved"→"took the tonsure"Added "to""Kusuko no Hen (the Kusuko's Rebellion)"→"the Kusuko Rebellion (Kusuko no Hen)"
sen.e: According to the temple history, the Futai-ji Temple was originally called 'Kaya no Gosho' (Thatched-Roofed Imperial Palace) where his grandfather, Emperor Heijo, took the tonsure and then retired to as a result of the Kusuko Incident.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションの位置を移動、Kusuko Rebellion→Kusuko Incidentとし、(Kusuko no Hen)を削除

sen.j: 平城天皇の皇子阿保親王やその息子である業平自身もこの地に住まいしていたと言われている。
sen.e: It is believed that Imperial Prince Abo, who was the son of Emperor Heijo, and Narihira, Imperial Prince Abo's son, also lived in this palace.
It is believed that Imperial Prince Abo, who was the son of Emperor Heijo, and Narihira also lived in this palace.
It is believed that Imperial Prince Abo, who was the son of Emperor Heijo, and Narihira also lived in this palace.

sen.j: 奈良県天理市、斑鳩町、大阪府八尾市
sen.e: Tenri City and Ikaruga-cho in Nara Prefecture, and Yao City in Osaka Prefecture
Tenri City and Ikaruga-cho in Nara Prefecture, and Yao City in Osaka Prefecture
Tenri City and Ikaruga-cho in Nara Prefecture, and Yao City in Osaka Prefecture

sen.j: 天理市櫟本町の在原神社は業平生誕の地とされる。
sen.e: The Ariwara-jinja Shrine in Ichinomoto-cho, Tenri City, is believed to be Narihira's birth place.
Ariwara-jinja Shrine in Ichinomoto-cho, Tenri City, is believed to be Narihira's birth place.
Ariwara-jinja Shrine in Ichinomoto-cho, Tenri City, is believed to be Narihira's birth place.

sen.j: 境内には伊勢物語にも登場する筒井筒がある。
sen.e: In the shrine, there is a tsutsuizutsu (curb of a well) that appeared in Ise Monogatari.
In the shrine, there is a (curb of a well) that is mentioned in Ise Monogatari.
sen.cmt: Deleted "tsutsuizutsu""(curb of a well)"→"well curb""appeared"→"is mentioned"
sen.e: In the shrine, there is a well curb that is mentioned in Ise Monogatari.
sen.cmt: (curb of a well)→well curbとしました。

sen.j: この在原神社から西には業平道（奈良街道竜田道）が伸びている。
sen.e: There is Narihara-do (Narihara road) (the Nara-kaido, Tatusta-do) westbound from this Ariwara-jinja Shrine.
Narihara-do (Narihara road), also known as Nara-kaido and Tatusta-do, leads west from Ariwara-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: Deleted "There is""(the Nara-kaido, Tatusta-do)"→", also known as Nara-kaido and Tatusta-do,""westbound"→"leads west"Deleted "this"
sen.e: Narihira-do (Narihara road), also known as Nara-kaido and Tatsuta-do, leads west from Ariwara-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 業平が高安の地に住む女性のもとへ通った道とされる。
sen.e: It is believed that Narihira used this road to visit a woman living in Takayasu.
It is believed that Narihira used this road to visit a woman living in Takayasu.
It is believed that Narihira used this road to visit a woman living in Takayasu.

sen.j: この高安が何処を指すかについては、奈良県生駒郡斑鳩町高安 (斑鳩町)と大阪府八尾市高安 (八尾市)の2説がある。
sen.e: There are two theories regarding the location of Takayasu, and one claims it was in Takayasu, Ikaruga-cho, Ikoma-gun, Nara Prefecture, and the other claims it was in Takayasu, Yao City, Osaka Prefecture.
There are two theories regarding the location of Takayasu, one claiming it is Takayasu, Ikaruga-cho, Ikoma-gun, Nara Prefecture, and the other claiming it is Takayasu, Yao City, Osaka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: "and one claims it was in"→"one claiming it is""claims it was in"→"claiming it is"
sen.e: There are two theories regarding the location of Takayasu, one claiming it is Takayasu, Ikaruga-cho, Ikoma-gun, Nara Prefecture, and the other claiming it is Takayasu, Yao City, Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: また、龍田から河内国高安郡への道筋については、大県郡（大阪府柏原市）を経由したとする説と、平群町の十三峠を越えたとする説がある。
sen.e: Also, as for the route from Tatsuta to Takayasu County of Kawachi no Kuni (Kawachi Province), there is a theory claiming that he went through Ogata, Kashiwabara City, Osaka Prefecture, and there is another theory claiming that he went over Jusan-toge in Heguri-cho.

Also, on his way from Tatsuta to Takayasu County in Kawachi no Kuni (Kawachi Province), one theory claims that he went through Ogata, Kashiwabara City, Osaka Prefecture, and another claims that he went over the Jusan-toge Pass in Heguri-cho.
sen.cmt: "as for the route"→"on his way""of"→"in""there is a theory claiming"→"one theory claims""there is another theory claiming"→"another claims"Added "the", "Pass"
sen.e: Also, on his way from Tatsuta to Takayasu County in Kawachi Province, one theory claims that he went through Ogata, Kashiwara City, Osaka Prefecture, and another claims that he went over the Jusan-toge Pass in Heguri-cho.
sen.cmt: Kawachi no Kuni を削除し、Kawachi Province のみとし、Kashiwabara City→Kashiwara Cityに訂正 (参照: http://www.city.kashiwara.osaka.jp/)

sen.j: 愛知県知立市八橋
sen.e: Yatsuhashi, Chiryu City, Aichi Prefecture
Yatsuhashi, Chiryu City, Aichi Prefecture
Yatsuhashi, Chiryu City, Aichi Prefecture

sen.j: 伊勢物語に登場する地名。
sen.e: This is the name of the place that appeared in Ise Monogatari.
This name appears in Ise Monogatari.
sen.cmt: "This is the name of the place that appeared"→"This name appears"
sen.e: This name appears in Ise Monogatari.

sen.j: 現在の知立市八橋とその周辺（安城市・豊田市）と言われる。
sen.e: It is believed that this refers to Yatsuhashi in Chiryu City and surrounding cities (Anjo and Toyota Cities).
It is believed that it refers to Yatsuhashi in Chiryu City and surrounding cities (Anjo and Toyota Cities).
It is believed that it refers to Yatsuhashi in Chiryu City and surrounding cities (Anjo and Toyota Cities).

sen.j: 海道記；かくて參河の國に至りぬ。
sen.e: Phrases from Kaido-ki (diary of a journey): So I arrived in Mikawa no kuni (Mikawa Province).
Excerpts from Kaido-ki (diary of a journey): So I arrived in Mikawa no kuni (Mikawa Province).
Excerpts from Kaido-ki (diary of a journey): So I arrived in Mikawa Province.
sen.cmt: Mikawa no kuni を削除し、Mikawa Provinceのみとしました。

sen.j: 雉鯉鮒が馬場をすぎて數里の野原を分くれば、一兩の橋を名づけて八橋といふ。
sen.e: On my horse I passed Chiryu and went on for a few miles, and there I found a bridge called Yatsuhashi.
On my horse I passed Chiryu and went on for a few miles, and there I found a bridge called Yatsuhashi.
On my horse I passed Chiryu and went on for a few miles, and there I found a bridge called Yatsuhashi.

sen.j: 東京都墨田区、埼玉県春日部市、兵庫県芦屋市、斑鳩町
sen.e: Sumida Ward in Tokyo Prefecture, Kasukabe City in Saitama Prefecture, and Ashiya City and Ikaruga Cho in Hyogo Prefecture.
Sumida Ward, Tokyo; Kasukabe City, Saitama Prefecture; Ashiya City and Ikaruga Cho, Hyogo Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Deleted "Prefecture"Changed "in" to commas and commas to semicolons
sen.e: Sumida Ward, Tokyo; Kasukabe City, Saitama Prefecture; Ashiya City and Ikaruga-cho, Hyogo Prefecture
sen.cmt: Ikaruga Cho→Ikaruga-choとし、ピリオド削除

sen.j: 墨田区に業平という地名があり、大横川だった場所に架かっている浅草通りの橋が業平橋である。
sen.e: There is a place called Narihira in Sumida Ward, and the bridge over the Asakusa-dori built on where the Oyoko-gawa River used to be is the Narihira-bashi Bridge.
There is a place called Narihira in Sumida Ward, and the bridge over Asakusa-dori, where the Oyoko-gawa River used to be, is called the Narihira-bashi Bridge.
There is a place called Narihira in Sumida Ward, and the bridge over Asakusa-dori Street, where the Oyoko-gawa River used to be, is called the Narihira-bashi Bridge.

sen.j: また、西側の隅田川に架かる吾妻橋の別称であるともいわれる。
sen.e: Some say that it is another name for Azuma-bashi Bridge that goes over the Sumida-gawa River that runs in the west.
This is also apparently another name for Azuma-bashi Bridge that leads to the west bank of Sumida-gawa River.
sen.cmt: "Some say that it is"→"This is also apparently""goes over the Sumida-gawa River that runs in the west"→"leads to the west bank of Sumida-gawa River"
sen.e: This is also apparently another name for Azuma-bashi Bridge that leads to the west bank of Sumida-gawa River.

sen.j: 春日部市の古隅田川、芦屋市の芦屋川、斑鳩町の富雄川にも業平橋という橋が架かっている。
sen.e: The Furusumida-gawa River in Kasukabe City, Ashiya-gawa River in Ashiya City, and the Tomio-gawa River in Ikaruga Cho also have bridges called the Narihira-bashi Bridge.
The Furusumida-gawa River in Kasukabe City, the Ashiya-gawa River in Ashiya City, and the Tomio-gawa River in Ikaruga Cho also have bridges called the Narihira-bashi Bridge.
The Furusumida-gawa River in Kasukabe City, the Ashiya-gawa River in Ashiya City, and the Tomio-gawa River in Ikaruga-cho also have bridges called the Narihira-bashi Bridge.

sen.j: 京都府京都市
sen.e: Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture
Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture
Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture

sen.j: 京都市西京区にある十輪寺 (京都市)は在原業平が晩年住んだといわれる寺で、業平寺とも言われる。
sen.e: The Jurin-ji Temple (Kyoto City) in Saikyo Ward, Kyoto City, is also known as the Narihira-dera Temple where ARIWARA no Narihira spent the last days of his life.
The Jurin-ji Temple in Saikyo Ward, Kyoto City, is also known as the Narihira-dera Temple, where ARIWARA no Narihira spent the last days of his life.
The Jurin-ji Temple in Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City, is also known as the Narihira-dera Temple, where ARIWARA no Narihira spent the last days of his life.

sen.j: 滋賀県高島市
sen.e: Takashima City, Shiga Prefecture
Takashima City, Shiga Prefecture
Takashima City, Shiga Prefecture

sen.j: 高島市マキノ町在原には、在原業平が晩年に隠遁したという伝説があり、業平の墓と伝えられる塔がある。
sen.e: There is a legend that ARIWARA no Narihira in his last years retired in the Arihara area in Makino Cho in Takashima City, and there is a tower that is said to be Narihira's grave.
There is a legend that ARIWARA no Narihira in his last years retired to the Arihara area of Makino Cho in Takashima City, and there is a tower that is said to be Narihira's grave.
There is a legend that ARIWARA no Narihira in his last years retired to the Arihara area of Makino-cho in Takashima City, and there is a tower that is said to be Narihira's grave.

sen.j: 「業平そば」も存在する。
sen.e: There is also 'Narihira noodle' in this area.
There is also a restaurant, 'Narihira noodle', in this area.
There is also a restaurant, 'Narihira noodle,' in this area.
